title: A2485 820-02100-11 issue
message:
Hi,
On this motherboard there was liquid damage.

Pin 6 of UR200 was not connected
Remplace RF242 too.

Now I have 5V 0.02A on the USB C meter with USB C port (cause magsafe charger no light).
Amps goes to 0.16 when pulse.

[SIZE=5][I]Voltage I have :[/I][/SIZE]
[LIST]
[*]LDO of CD3217B12
[LIST]
[*][B]PP1V5_UPC0_LDO_CORE [/B]1.5V
[*][B]PP3V3_UPC0_LDO [/B]3V
[/LIST]
[*][B]PPHV_INT0_AONSW [/B]5V
[*][B]PPVBUS_USBC0 [/B]5V
[*][COLOR=rgb(0, 0, 0)][B]PP3V8_AON[/B] 3.8V[/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=rgb(0, 0, 0)][B]PP1V8_AON[/B] 1.8V[/COLOR]
[/LIST]

[I]I have pulse (see picture attached for timing pulse) on :[/I]
[LIST]
[*][B]PP1V8_S2 [/B]1.8V (seems that U7700 shorted it to ground when it's LOW)
[*][B]PP1V2_S2[/B] [COLOR=rgb(235, 107, 86)]Only 0.6V[/COLOR]
[*][B]PP1V2_AWAKE [/B]1.2V
[*][B]PP1V8_AWAKE [/B]1.8V
[/LIST]
I have nothing on :
[LIST]
[*][B][B]PP5V_S2SW_USBC01[/B][/B]
[*][B][B]PP3V3_S2[/B][/B]
[*][B][B]PP3V3_AON[/B][/B]
[/LIST]
I changed the 3 CD3217B12 from M1 A2337 donor.. Behavior is the same
Nothing is hot at the thermal camera

I am running out of idea, if someone has will send some love :D

title: A2485 820-02100-11 issue
message:
There must be something else affected by corrosion.
Check U8100 and U7700 LDOs.

PPBUS_AON exact voltage?
It is stable?

title: A2485 820-02100-11 issue
message:
Hi, sorry for late, need to do some other stuff for customers.

Thanks in advance :)

title: A2485 820-02100-11 issue
message:
U8100's VLDO1 (3V3_S2) must be stable, if VIN_LDO1 is stable (3V8_AON).
If not, there may be a problem with U8100, M1 CPU, or other component connected there.
I recommend to try reballing U8100 first.

title: A2485 820-02100-11 issue
message:
Hi,
Successfully reball U8100 and U7700.
There was not oxydation under these chips
Nothing more, still pulse

title: A2485 820-02100-11 issue
message:
Check all seconday power supplies.
Maybe PMUs detect a problem and cycle power.

You may also have problems with M1 CPU.

title: A2485 820-02100-11 issue
message:
Thanks for your reply, do you have some informations about secondary power supply ?
I work on windows laptop, mac is a bit different ^^
Thanks

title: A2485 820-02100-11 issue
message:
Any voltage generated from main power supply using a buck converter.
Same theory applies like on any other laptop.

Look at the coils from the MLB, the ones having a MOSFET connected to PPBUS_AON; for example L/Q5800/20/40.
There may be also power chips which include the MOSFETs; like L/U9400/20, L/U9500, L/UC260, L/UF800.

Many low level voltages are generated from 3V8_AON; for example the small coils around U7700 and U8100.
There you can't find direct short to PPBUS_AON, but can block the power sequence.
